trans-unit.source: DirectX game project templates
trans-unit.target: DirectX game project templates

trans-unit.source: Learn about the templates for creating a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) and DirectX game.
trans-unit.target: Learn about the templates for creating a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) and DirectX game.

trans-unit.source: DirectX game project templates
trans-unit.target: DirectX game project templates

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: The DirectX and Universal Windows Platform (UWP) templates allow you to quickly create a project as a starting point for your game.
trans-unit.target: The DirectX and Universal Windows Platform (UWP) templates allow you to quickly create a project as a starting point for your game.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To create the project you need to:
trans-unit.target: To create the project you need to:

trans-unit.source: [Download Microsoft Visual Studio 2015](https://www.visualstudio.com/vs-2015-product-editions).
trans-unit.target: [Download Microsoft Visual Studio 2015](https://www.visualstudio.com/vs-2015-product-editions).

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 has tools for graphics programming, such as debugging tools.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 has tools for graphics programming, such as debugging tools.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of DirectX graphics and gaming features and tools, see [Visual Studio tools for DirectX game development](set-up-visual-studio-for-game-development.md).
trans-unit.target: For an overview of DirectX graphics and gaming features and tools, see [Visual Studio tools for DirectX game development](set-up-visual-studio-for-game-development.md).

trans-unit.source: Choosing a template
trans-unit.target: Choosing a template

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 includes three DirectX and UWP templates:
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 includes three DirectX and UWP templates:

trans-unit.source: DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) - The DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) template creates a UWP project, which renders directly to an app window using DirectX 11.
trans-unit.target: DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) - The DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) template creates a UWP project, which renders directly to an app window using DirectX 11.

trans-unit.source: DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows) - The DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows) template creates a project UWP, which renders directly to an app window using DirectX 12.
trans-unit.target: DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows) - The DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows) template creates a project UWP, which renders directly to an app window using DirectX 12.

trans-unit.source: DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) - The DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) template creates a UWP project, which renders inside a XAML control using DirectX 11.
trans-unit.target: DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) - The DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) template creates a UWP project, which renders inside a XAML control using DirectX 11.

trans-unit.source: This template uses a [**SwapChainPanel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn252834), so you can use XAML UI controls.
trans-unit.target: This template uses a [**SwapChainPanel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn252834), so you can use XAML UI controls.

trans-unit.source: This can make adding user interface elements easier, but using the XAML template may result in lower performance.
trans-unit.target: This can make adding user interface elements easier, but using the XAML template may result in lower performance.

trans-unit.source: Which template you choose depends on the performance and what technologies you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Which template you choose depends on the performance and what technologies you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Template structure
trans-unit.target: Template structure

trans-unit.source: The DirectX Universal Windows templates contain the following files:
trans-unit.target: The DirectX Universal Windows templates contain the following files:

trans-unit.source: pch.h and pch.cpp - Precompiled header support.
trans-unit.target: pch.h and pch.cpp - Precompiled header support.

trans-unit.source: Package.appxmanifest - The properties of the deployment package for the app.
trans-unit.target: Package.appxmanifest - The properties of the deployment package for the app.

trans-unit.source: \*.pfx - Certificates for the application.
trans-unit.target: \*.pfx - Certificates for the application.

trans-unit.source: External Dependencies - Links to external files the project use.s
trans-unit.target: External Dependencies - Links to external files the project use.s

trans-unit.source: \*Main.h and \*Main.cpp - Methods for managing application assets, updating application state, and rendering the frame.
trans-unit.target: \*Main.h and \*Main.cpp - Methods for managing application assets, updating application state, and rendering the frame.

trans-unit.source: App.h and App.cpp - Main entry point for the application.
trans-unit.target: App.h and App.cpp - Main entry point for the application.

trans-unit.source: Connects the app with the Windows shell and handles application lifecycle events.
trans-unit.target: Connects the app with the Windows shell and handles application lifecycle events.

trans-unit.source: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) and DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows) templates.
trans-unit.target: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) and DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows) templates.

trans-unit.source: App.xaml, App.xaml.cpp, and App.xaml.h - Main entry point for the application.
trans-unit.target: App.xaml, App.xaml.cpp, and App.xaml.h - Main entry point for the application.

trans-unit.source: Connects the app with the Windows shell and handles application lifecycle events.
trans-unit.target: Connects the app with the Windows shell and handles application lifecycle events.

trans-unit.source: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) template.
trans-unit.target: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) template.

trans-unit.source: DirectXPage.xaml, DirectXPage.xaml.cpp, and DirectXPage.xaml.h - A page that hosts a DirectX SwapChainPanel.
trans-unit.target: DirectXPage.xaml, DirectXPage.xaml.cpp, and DirectXPage.xaml.h - A page that hosts a DirectX SwapChainPanel.

trans-unit.source: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) template.
trans-unit.target: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) template.

trans-unit.source: Content
trans-unit.target: Content

trans-unit.source: Sample3DSceneRenderer.h and Sample3DSceneRenderer.cpp - A sample renderer that instantiates a basic rendering pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Sample3DSceneRenderer.h and Sample3DSceneRenderer.cpp - A sample renderer that instantiates a basic rendering pipeline.

trans-unit.source: SampleFpsTextRenderer.h and SampleFpsTextRenderer.cpp - Renders the current FPS value in the bottom right corner of the screen using Direct2D and DirectWrite.
trans-unit.target: SampleFpsTextRenderer.h and SampleFpsTextRenderer.cpp - Renders the current FPS value in the bottom right corner of the screen using Direct2D and DirectWrite.

trans-unit.source: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) and DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) templates.
trans-unit.target: These files only appear in the DirectX 11 App (Universal Windows) and DirectX 11 and XAML App (Universal Windows) templates.

trans-unit.source: SamplePixelShader.hlsl - A simple example pixel shader.
trans-unit.target: SamplePixelShader.hlsl - A simple example pixel shader.

trans-unit.source: SampleVertexShader.hlsl - A simple example vertex shader.
trans-unit.target: SampleVertexShader.hlsl - A simple example vertex shader.

trans-unit.source: ShaderStructures.h - Structures used to send date to the example vertex shader.
trans-unit.target: ShaderStructures.h - Structures used to send date to the example vertex shader.

trans-unit.source: Common
trans-unit.target: Common

trans-unit.source: StepTimer.h - A helper class for animation and simulation timing.
trans-unit.target: StepTimer.h - A helper class for animation and simulation timing.

trans-unit.source: DirectXHelper.h - Misc Helper functions.
trans-unit.target: DirectXHelper.h - Misc Helper functions.

trans-unit.source: DeviceResources.h and Device Resources.cpp - Provides an interface for an application that owns DeviceResources to be notified of the device being lost or created.
trans-unit.target: DeviceResources.h and Device Resources.cpp - Provides an interface for an application that owns DeviceResources to be notified of the device being lost or created.

trans-unit.source: d3dx12.h - Contains the D3DX12 utility library.
trans-unit.target: d3dx12.h - Contains the D3DX12 utility library.

trans-unit.source: This file only appears in the DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows).
trans-unit.target: This file only appears in the DirectX 12 App (Universal Windows).

trans-unit.source: Assets - Logo and splashscreen images used by the application.
trans-unit.target: Assets - Logo and splashscreen images used by the application.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a starting point, add to it to build your game development knowledge and Windows Store game development skills.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a starting point, add to it to build your game development knowledge and Windows Store game development skills.

trans-unit.source: If you are porting an existing game, see the following topics.
trans-unit.target: If you are porting an existing game, see the following topics.

trans-unit.source: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1
trans-unit.target: Port from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.1

trans-unit.source: Port from DirectX 9 to Universal Windows Platform
trans-unit.target: Port from DirectX 9 to Universal Windows Platform

trans-unit.source: If you are creating a new DirectX game, see the following topics.
trans-unit.target: If you are creating a new DirectX game, see the following topics.

trans-unit.source: Create a simple UWP game with DirectX
trans-unit.target: Create a simple UWP game with DirectX

trans-unit.source: Developing Marble Maze, a Universal Windows Platform game in C++ and DirectX
trans-unit.target: Developing Marble Maze, a Universal Windows Platform game in C++ and DirectX

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
